Award.AwardTitle: NSF Student and Early-Career Faculty Travel Grant for IEEE International Conference on Software Engineering 2020 (ICSE)

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Division.LongName: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funds for students and junior faculty to travel to the International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE 2020), which takes place in Seoul, Korea in May of 2020. ICSE is the flagship technical conference in the field. The conference is a venue for technical presentations of the latest research results, interactions between academia and industry, and international collaborations.

The award seeks to increase and broaden participation in mentoring programs such as the Doctoral Symposium, the New Faculty Symposium, and the Student Mentoring Workshop. The objective is to provide education, training and mentoring and to nurture a globally-aware workforce of research and educators within the US and build the community of researchers in the field of Software Engineering.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The overriding goal of the NSF ICSE 2020 Travel Award Program was to further the research directions and careers of diverse students and junior faculty members in software engineering at US-based colleges and universities. Toward this end, the project intended to support them to attend the premier research conference in the field of software engineering, the 42st International Conference on Software Engineering (ICSE 2020); participate in ICSE’s mentoring, networking, and professional development programs (Student Mentoring Workshop, Doctoral Symposium, and New Faculty Symposium); and attend one or more ICSE workshops and co-located events, which serve as incubators for scientific communities that form and share a particular research agenda.

ICSE provides an environment where ideas are created, exchanged, and synthesized as researchers, practitioners, and educators present and discuss the most recent innovations, trends, experiences, and challenges in the field of software engineering. Results presented at past ICSEs laid the foundation for work in areas ranging from software correctness and robustness, to software architecture and analysis, to the impact of software on society, and more. Similarly, leading-edge results reported at ICSE 2020 will lay the foundation for the future in areas known and unknown, as is vital for a world in which software has become ubiquitous.  

Due to the pandemic, the conference was held virtually and no travel awards were made. Many mentoring activities were shifted online to a virtual format as a compromise. No awarded funds were used.
